markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="">[Thessekka](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2111)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

As a leader in the xulgath incursion of the surface of the Isle of Kortos, Thessekka—a xulgath alchemist with the powers of a stoneliege and more—has risen swiftly through the ranks of her Darklands kin, although her hunger for domination is far from sated.

 Thessekka has hungered from the moment of her birth: hungered for food, hungered for companionship, and hungered for power. As she grew, she began to learn stone-binding, with an eye toward earning her place as a stoneliege, a rare and prestigious position. Such was her desire for power, however, that moments after she completed the ritual to become a stoneliege, she threatened the alchemist who performed the ritual and demanded he teach her all he knew of mixing chemicals and warping flesh. Thessekka proved an eager and intelligent student, and once she had exhausted the alchemist's knowledge, she killed and ate him. But this, too, failed to fill the ravenous void within her. When rumors of an invasion of the sun-blighted surface rippled among xulgath tribes, Thessekka knew she had found a mission that might finally satisfy her.

 Thessekka bullied a few minions into joining this invasion force alongside her, but she lacked the influence of a true leader. Instead she was given the position of a hardscale, a subsidiary position below Surkitama, a leader in her clutch. Surkitama's force was assigned to a surface region called the Swardlands, where three aeon towers stood that held _aeon orbs_ stolen from the xulgaths five millennia ago. Surkitama's force was to secure these towers from uplander interference before finding a way to crack the stolen orbs to bring destruction to the surface world. Always looking for opportunities to seize power, Thessekka used the journey to gather misfits to her side, including the dero [Ginjana Mindkeeper](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2109) and the roper Ro'oosk. She also won the trust of a duergar explorer, eyeing his useful magical ring, only to kill him and take the ring for herself.

 Surkitama's force moved swiftly upon reaching the Swardlands, locating and securing the three aeon towers. By this time, Thessekka had risen in prominence enough to command one of the tower garrisons. She quickly established a hold over her assigned garrison, the Wellspring Tower, and set up an alchemist laboratory within it. Without much oversight from Surkitama, who had underestimated the difficulty of travel among the towers and was preoccupied with trying (and failing) to conquer the Swardlands, Thessekka devised a way to siphon the _aeon orb's_ energy even as Surkitama's leadership began to falter. Thessekka used her _[ring of stoneshifting](/Equipment.aspx?ID=634)_ to secretly journey between the towers and foment rebellion in the discontented clutches under Surkitama's command.

When golems at the Liferoot Stone decimated the xulgath garrison there, Thessekka knew her time to strike was at hand. Traveling via the _ring of stoneshifting_, she rallied her disgruntled allies to move against Surkitama's loyalists. Able to appear and disappear in an instant, she prevented the xulgath leader from bringing the full force of his power to bear against her. And when the shadowy form of a dero slipped unseen into Surkitama's personal chambers, Surkitama became just another of Ginjana's experiments, and Thessekka stepped into the power vacuum to lead all the xulgaths in the Swardlands. By the time her xulgath superiors discovered her coup, Thessekka's efforts to siphon the Wellspring Tower _aeon orb_ were proving successful, so she was given official command of the Swardland forces. 

<title level="2" right="">Campaign Role</title> Thessekka is the true mastermind behind the xulgaths in the Swardlands. Once she has drained away the energy of all the _aeon orbs_ and met her obligations to her xulgath masters, she plans to carve out her own surface world kingdom. She sees the soft humanoids who currently inhabit the Swardlands as mere cattle for her consumption, and she plans to subjugate them as the bountiful land that has sustained them dies. With her _ring of stoneshifting_, Thessekka can move freely between the three aeon towers and directly oversee operations. At first, she dismisses the heroes as too feeble and too few in number to pose a real threat, and she keeps her focus on other towers. By the time the heroes prove themselves a true threat by clearing the xulgaths out of two aeon towers, Thessekka realizes that dismissing them was a mistake. She confronts them at the final tower, where she plans to end their threat and devour their charred corpses.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 42

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 40

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 37
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 14">[Thessekka](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2111)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Unique" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=161" />
<trait label="CE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=91" />
<trait label="Xulgath" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=244" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #153: Life's Long Shadows](/Sources.aspx?ID=29) pg. 90</row>

**Perception** +26; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=40) (imprecise) 30 feet

**Languages**
[Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Undercommon](/Languages.aspx?ID=11)

**Skills**
[Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +24, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +28, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +28, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +23, [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=9) +24, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +22, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +22

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** +1

**Con** +4

**Int** +4

**Wis** +2

**Cha** +1
</row>

**Infused Items** Thessekka carries the following infused items: 1 [greater acid flask](/Equipment.aspx?ID=74), 2 [greater alchemist's fires](/Equipment.aspx?ID=75), 1 [moderate bravo's brew](/Equipment.aspx?ID=84), 2 [greater frost vials](/Equipment.aspx?ID=77), 1 [greater quicksilver mutagen](/Equipment.aspx?ID=277), 1 [greater tanglefoot bag](/Equipment.aspx?ID=78). These items last for 24 hours, or until the next time Thessekka makes her daily preparations.

**Items**
_[greater alchemist goggles](/Equipment.aspx?ID=408)_, [expert alchemist's tools](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2), formula book, infused reagents, _[ring of stoneshifting](/Equipment.aspx?ID=634)_

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 35 

**Fort** +26 

**Ref** +19 

**Will** +22 

</row>

**HP** 255

**Resistances**
physical 14

**Powerful Stench** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [olfactory](/Traits.aspx?ID=246)) 30 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a DC 34 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature is [sickened 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34), and on a critical failure, the creature is also [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) for as long as it is sickened. While within range of Thessekka's stench, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths' stenches for 1 minute.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 20 feet, burrow 10 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +28,
**Damage** 3d8+12 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +28 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)),
**Damage** 3d6+12 slashing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18)

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
alchemical bomb +27 ([range increment 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [Splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=150)),
**Damage** varies by bomb

**Primal Innate Spells** DC 34
- **4th**
[Shape Stone](/Spells.aspx?ID=276)

**Alchemical Formulas**   greater acid flask, greater alchemist's fire, greater antidote, moderate bravo's brew, greater comprehension elixir, greater frost vial, greater quicksilver mutagen, stone fist elixir, greater tanglefoot bag

**Earthen Blow** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** Thessekka commands nearby earth to attack a foe. Thessekka makes a claw Strike against a creature that is within 60 feet of her and 10 feet of an earthen surface, such as dirt, mud, stone, or sand. The Strike originates from the surface's square and has a [reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=192) of 10 feet. On a critical hit, the target is also knocked [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31).

**Earthen Torrent** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) **Frequency** once per minute; **Requirements** Thessekka is standing on or next to at least 10 cubic feet of dirt, stone, or other earthen material; **Effect** Thessekka creates a violent wave of roiling earth. Creatures in a 15-foot cone take 10d10 bludgeoning damage (DC 34 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save; on a critical failure, creatures are also knocked [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31)).

**Expanded Splash**   Thessekka's bombs with the [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=150) trait deal 4 additional splash damage and deal splash damage to all creatures within 10 feet.

**Quick Alchemy** <actions string="Single Action" />  **Cost** 1 batch of infused reagents; **Effect** Thessekka creates a single alchemical item from her formula book (see Alchemical Formulas). This item has the [infused](/Traits.aspx?ID=94) trait, but it remains potent only until the end of her next turn.

**Quick Bomber** <actions string="Single Action" />  Thessekka Interacts to draw a bomb, then Strikes with it.

**Stone Throes** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) Thessekka turns her own body into solid stone like a statue and immediately becomes [petrified](/Conditions.aspx?ID=30). Any creature [grappled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) or [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33) by her becomes [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24); to get free, the creature must damage the statue enough to break it or succeed at a DC 36 [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) check to [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79). The only action Thessekka can take while petrified is to use Stone Throes again to end the effect.

</column>
name: Thessekka
